main event: 17 saucers were reported sighted in the sky over the Bronx, New York on July 23, 1952, by Harry Swirsky and corroborated by three other witnesses.
interesting points: The objects were reported to vary in size from a few inches to about two feet across., The saucers appeared reddish-orange in color and moved in a quick, irregular manner., The sighting lasted around 45 minutes, with the objects becoming visible only for a few seconds at a time., The sightings were corroborated by multiple witnesses including two women and two men., The incident attracted attention from the Air Force officials who were said to be investigating.
witness description: The witnesses included Harry Swirsky and three others, who described the objects' rapid movement and saw them during the evening.
